Hi, 

I am doing a quick comparison between wget and heritrix.  
I configur=
ed both to use the same seed:
http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/defaul=
t.stm and same depth level 
(2). I also used same number of retries, timeou=
t. 

For Heritrix I used the not-on-host decide rule to restrict to URLs
fr=
om news.bbc.co.uk and replace the ARC writer with Mirror writer.
Then I ran=
 both together to make sure the site does not change a lot.

Now, when I co=
mpare the set of fetched pages, they are VERY different.  
In fact, Heritri=
x seems to miss out many pages/URLs that I expected
it to be able to fetch.=
  So my question is, how do they different in 
each other in terms of the a=
lgorithm used in crawling and fetching 
pages. 

Thanks,

Philip
